data.text:
Digital inclusion is about much more than access to the internet - it's about social justice, equity, fairness, autonomy and opportunity. 

Follow #IGF2019 discussions on creating an inclusive information society: https://t.co/unumUmQWPE https://t.co/CKtAXJudEI

Abuse isn't always physical.

On Monday's International Day to End Violence against Women, get the facts on abuse & violence from @UN_Women: https://t.co/4knWbJQLrS #orangetheworld https://t.co/MKA5kQaOfl

Greenhouse gas concentrations in the atmosphere hit new record high in 2018, leading to

🌡 rising temperatures
🌪 extreme weather
🌊 sea level rise & more. 

Get details in new @WMO report, ahead of next week's UN Climate Conference #COP25: https://t.co/XEcoZHNujw #ClimateAction https://t.co/Ukfcp0e7Y8

"Together, we can – and must -- end rape and sexual assault of all kinds."

-- @antonioguterres on Monday's International Day to End Violence against Women. https://t.co/bXtTsUS1cv #orangetheworld https://t.co/g2yxCnrxXI
Starts this week at @UNGeneva: Committee on the Elimination of Racial Discrimination, 100th session (through 13 Dec): https://t.co/6knOwiF1nn #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/YgV30JuRyT
Continues this week at UNHQ: Commission on the Limits of the Continental Shelf, 51st session (through 29 November). https://t.co/KJ1juaPwZu https://t.co/jGRTf83UU0

Continues this week @UNGeneva: Committee against Torture, 68th session (through 6 December).

Info & Documents here: https://t.co/KKUsqPG4Wb https://t.co/Lf7ZsfKyEb

There are no blurred lines when it comes to consent. 
There is no excuse for rape. 

On Monday's Intl Day to End Violence against Women, @UN_Women explains how YOU can take action: https://t.co/1GfdwyEet7 #orangetheworld https://t.co/hxnlxGS5Kr

Happening this week: Internet Governance Forum #IGF2019, #PalestineDay, #WorldAIDSDay & much more.

Full list is here: https://t.co/aOqF6cdxHx https://t.co/k147KJA6Vd

In 1 week, reps of governments, cities, business & civil society will gather in Madrid for the UN Climate Conference #COP25 under the presidency of Chile
to move forward with #ClimateAction.

Get details from @UNFCCC: https://t.co/3cr9HmXVGK https://t.co/FcCPg2ESLE

Believe survivors. 
Don’t excuse perpetrators. 
Don’t joke about gender-based violence.

Monday is the Int'l Day to End Violence against Women:  https://t.co/ZILe324Ozz via @UN_Women #orangetheworld https://t.co/Lv7RW58d1r

"What we like to do is bridge cultures together."

Thanks @Globies 🏀 for visiting us in NYC to learn about our work around for people around the world! https://t.co/rXTDl6GbX9

Ahead of the  Int'l Day to End Violence against Women, watch the mother of one of the Chibok school girls kidnapped in Nigeria 5+ years ago by Boko Haram talk about her heartache. https://t.co/mNyP4xTc5c

📢: "climate emergency" is the @OxfordWords phrase of the year.

Its use rose dramatically in 2019, as people everywhere increasingly call for #ClimateAction to save our planet & its people. https://t.co/eDvbJhzKZK

Women & girls represent half of the world’s population, yet, no country has achieved gender equality.

Advancing women's empowerment & gender equality is critical to achieving the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/xFh4Q1w8MK via @UN_Women https://t.co/J7XZEgztFm

“My mother told me: ‘Go. Save your life.’”

Meet Farouk, a 16 year-old boy from Afghanistan, who endured an unimaginably difficult journey across 10 countries.

Now, with support from @Refugees, he's beginning a new life in safety. https://t.co/brFInBHpHB

Alcohol kills millions of people every year.

Liver damage
Cancer
Heart disease 
& poor mental health

These are just some of the serious health risks posed by excessive alcohol use.
@WHO has more info: https://t.co/Lrgu7uiTLg https://t.co/RNGppiC9au

Huge advancements in the well-being of children have been made in the 30 years since the adoption of the Convention on the Rights of the Child.

Yet, progress has been uneven, leaving behind many of the the poorest, most vulnerable, @UNICEF warns. https://t.co/AWBgoi8hCU https://t.co/qdOQG6G4c0

75% of men are in the global labour force, compared to only 48% of women, worldwide.

Workplace discrimination is a human rights violation, with far-reaching social & economic consequences.. https://t.co/IQdqva7s0v via @ilo https://t.co/jkpTPqDfgr

Everyone has the right to seek asylum from persecution.

Here's how @Refugees works to protect those forced to flee: https://t.co/n4ejLcwGPE https://t.co/VBhFlarNo3

.@AfghanMissionUN's @AdelaRaz & her daughter joined other children, world leaders & celebrities at UNHQ this week for @UNICEF's #WorldChildrensDay celebrations. https://t.co/E53tO8xinw https://t.co/kdlNWnMbNc

"We learned what peace, security & development means for women in the Horn of Africa -- a region anticipating & preparing for a lasting & sustainable peace."

-- @AminaJMohammed shares more about her recent solidarity visit in this new @Medium piece. https://t.co/rOUg4kPsr9

Revised UN guidelines aim to help former combatants lay down their weapons and successfully return to civilian life. 

More on how the UN is promoting disarmament, demobilization & reintegration of former armed groups: https://t.co/iZz7Gb2N94
Ebola: New disease transmission chain & attacks by armed groups on civilians risk reversing major gains against the epidemic in Democratic Republic of Congo. https://t.co/cyRHrWiSrv

The @Globies 🏀 came to #VisitUN Headquarters to learn more about our work around the 🌎. 

Here’s how YOU can take a tour of UNHQ in NYC ➡️ https://t.co/0dhYU4xnS6 https://t.co/g7fVb5kh97
@Globies Thank you for your visit and support for the #GlobalGoals.

Yemen: Momentum building for political settlement to country's conflict, @OSE_Yemen tells Security Council, as UN & partners continue delivering world's largest humanitarian operation.
https://t.co/O3IIF4a7bZ

A specialized team of men & women #ServingForPeace with @UNIFIL_ found a unique way to connect with the communities they serve, while helping young people with disabilities build their skills. 

https://t.co/1tFEEkQmUE

4 out of 5 adolescents are not getting enough physical activity, putting their current & future health at risk.

New health warning from @WHO on the importance of physical activity for young people: https://t.co/nXc9OgIUpy #BeActive https://t.co/UDUu8QmXDS

Magdalena gave birth to Neymar two days after crossing from Venezuela into Brazil. 

She’s one of 4M+ people who’ve fled Venezuela due to violence, insecurity & lack of basic services. 

@Refugees is providing protection & shelter to families like hers.

https://t.co/050ZeL9fgR

Catastrophic cyclones & the worsening climate crisis have left nearly 12 million people suffering from severe food insecurity in Southern Africa. 

@UNOCHA is scaling up operations to help support those in need. https://t.co/GhADJ1GgGt https://t.co/woolukWLXH

#WorldWildlifeDay 2020 will focus on "Sustaining all life on Earth" -- with special emphasis on the sustainable use of natural resources for achieving the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/Wp7JeyikWX via @CITES https://t.co/MJq37pkVUL

No more sexist ads.
No more stereotypical roles.
No more objectification.

On Thursday's #WorldTelevisionDay, join @UN_Women and show your support for new standards on how women & girls are portrayed on-screen. https://t.co/4mZwRVcd1e https://t.co/ErNTZladxz

Fishing is considered one of the most dangerous occupations in the 🌍, with an estimated 32,000+ fatalities a year.

On #WorldFisheriesDay, @FAO stresses the need to ensure fishers’ safety while sustainably managing world’s aquatic resources. https://t.co/3yc3NhHD2z https://t.co/xjorJu8Rxs

News: use of the phrase "climate emergency" increased dramatically in 2019, becoming the most written about emergency by a huge margin, says @OxfordWords. 

People everywhere are calling for urgent #ClimateAction to protect our planet and our future. https://t.co/Oz5HcqMbCa

Philosophy creates the intellectual conditions needed for peace and the achievement of the #GlobalGoals.

Thursday is World #PhilosophyDay: https://t.co/VBYDTiSskH https://t.co/r0WmtK2h5Q

On Thursday's #WorldTVDay, join TV icon and #GlobalGoals supporter Hello Kitty and learn more about worldwide efforts to end poverty, reduce inequality, tackle the climate crisis & more. https://t.co/Gnldb7CMX5 #HelloGlobalGoals https://t.co/kaeTSMjSr4

Do you have a favourite philosopher?

Thursday's #PhilosophyDay is an opportunity to highlight the importance of critical thinking to find new ways of living together & building fairer societies. More from @UNESCO: https://t.co/QEYmyUNQmU https://t.co/QU4Ca7mzmv
Thursday's #PhilosophyDay celebrates the importance of reflection and critical thinking. Find out more: https://t.co/VBYDTiAQW7 https://t.co/ZHUZmWh2JL

As the UN & partners scale up humanitarian assistance for 6.8 million people suffering from undernourishment in Venezuela, family gardens are helping to bridge the nutrition gap. via @UNOCHA https://t.co/iokmvEPy6a

.@UNICEF Goodwill Ambassadors David Beckham and Millie Bobby Brown joined children at UNHQ in NYC to celebrate #WorldChildrensDay and speak for child rights #ForEveryChild. https://t.co/E53tO8fHvY https://t.co/8Viky5L3eu

Countries are planning to produce 120% more fossil fuels than what's need to limit global warming to 1.5°C.

This makes #ClimateAction goals harder to reach and puts our planet & our future in danger. https://t.co/4ojLvjxw5v https://t.co/hfeFwygg6X

Wednesday's #WorldChildrensDay marks 30 years since the Convention on the Rights of the Child was adopted - a historic commitment guiding @UNICEF's work for children in 190+ countries. https://t.co/FsKhEeVpU1 https://t.co/7LO6ZEOfMJ

"Industrial development is of critical importance for sustained & inclusive economic growth in African countries."

-- @antonioguterres on Wednesday's Africa Industrialization Day. https://t.co/3DNsNvt91X https://t.co/AA7Ynf6UI7

Millions of people across the Sahel are facing hunger & malnutrition due to widespread violence & impacts of the climate crisis.

@WFP is providing food assistance and warning that a rapid & escalated humanitarian response is needed to save lives. https://t.co/3nX3HICsit https://t.co/sCr6wgxGwS

These inspiring children are speaking out, claiming their rights and leading the way to the world they deserve.

Join them this #WorldChildrensDay & raise your voice #ForEveryChild. https://t.co/FsKhEeVpU1 https://t.co/3Fx71958fr
Wednesday's Africa Industrialization Day highlights the continent's sustainable economic growth & its efforts to reduce poverty. https://t.co/PUfFLVGkLo https://t.co/ekDniiOrq5

We need a social contract that is inclusive & equitable;  that enables everyone to live in dignity.

-- @antonioguterres to Security Council https://t.co/wayz3lIqkK https://t.co/4X3RxbhGR0

Let’s build a 🌍 where every child is safe from harm and has the opportunity to learn. 📚

More from @UNICEF on Wednesday's #WorldChildrensDay: https://t.co/FsKhEeDP2t https://t.co/DraNlQsOeE
World leaders pledge $2.6 billion to vaccinate 450 million children annually to #EndPolio. via @WHO https://t.co/ojF4tfvBYK

Aid is not helping in the way it could.

@UNCTAD calls for new aid agenda to help least developed countries escape aid dependency. https://t.co/Tgg9sneE9F https://t.co/v0zOOsmtCm

Everyone has the right to safe and hygienic sanitation services that provide privacy and ensure dignity.

On Tuesday's #WorldToiletDay, learn how YOU can take action to tackle the global sanitation crisis. https://t.co/KayLIqN4eb https://t.co/D2RdDfz5iY

Fisheries make a vital contribution to food, nutrition & jobs security & are key to achieving the #GlobalGoals, but illegal & unregulated fishing threaten the future of our oceans. More from @FAO #SustainableFisheries Symposium. https://t.co/l5h4JpSGbR https://t.co/3g8ILH9p7s

It's World Antibiotic Awareness Week.

Preventing infections is key to stopping the spread of antibiotic resistance. More from @WHO: https://t.co/u9lVJYBjUN https://t.co/zHPOBGbbIf

Billions worldwide lack access to safely-managed sanitation, with poor & marginalized people disproportionately affected.

On Tuesday's #WorldToiletDay, see how the #GlobalGoals aim to ensure access to sanitation for all by 2030. https://t.co/HLx87eF7EL https://t.co/wykVNx3O9G

For billions of people around the 🌏, sanitation systems are either non-existent or ineffective.

See what's being done to address the global sanitation crisis on Tuesday's #WorldToiletDay: https://t.co/KayLIqN4eb https://t.co/lUDZtyX7e5

.@UNESCO's 40th General Conference is underway in Paris, and this year's theme - '(Re)generation' - focuses on the role of young people in shaping the global agenda for peace.

See this essential guide featuring special guest @ElyxYak: https://t.co/yRLK0gQezI #IChoosePeace https://t.co/7ndw5vk7O8

➡️ 4.2 billion live without safely-managed sanitation
➡️ 673 million practice open defecation
➡️ 3 billion lack basic hand-washing facilities

On Tuesday's #WorldToiletDay, see how you can help support sanitation for all: https://t.co/VMIrjmwvby https://t.co/P9O57vAe74
Establishment of a Middle East zone free of nuclear & other weapons of mass destruction under discussion at UNHQ in NYC this week. https://t.co/RQbU6JJmc6 https://t.co/0uJtaaJyNb

One year ago, @ImpactUN launched a new partnership with academia to promote the #GloalGoals and: 

🔬 Foster innovative scholarship
🤝 Engage educational institutions
💪 Empower youth

Highlights of their work: https://t.co/chSKjnlo6J https://t.co/U4pcWlXcoC

Children are living longer, better & healthier lives than ever before, but more needs to be done for the poorest, most vulnerable.

30 years since adoption of the Convention on the Rights of the Child, @UNICEF explains how to ensure every child's rights.

https://t.co/Q6Bj9oFIS7

UN launches mosquito sterilization testing to combat malaria & dengue worldwide.

The goal is to reduce number of mosquitoes & slow disease transmission. https://t.co/8Er7mpH9Lb
Continues this week at UNHQ: Commission on the Limits of the Continental Shelf, 51st session (through 29 November). https://t.co/KJ1juaPwZu https://t.co/oEGOQci77o

Continues this week @UNGeneva: Committee against Torture, 68th session (through 6 December).  

Info & Documents here: https://t.co/KKUsqPou4D https://t.co/eQX5s0ToyN

Happening this week:  #WorldChildrensDay, #WorldToiletDay, World Antibiotic Awareness Week & much more.

Full list is here: https://t.co/aOqF6cv967 https://t.co/XNoUlC6NTL

"I have never wavered in my belief that the United Nations is the only community in the world that can truly gather together people."

-- @UNAIDS and @WHO Goodwill Ambassador @JamesChau. https://t.co/AvGarovgUj https://t.co/yEbZkVU9YJ
Meet the brave young women who have been a driving force for peace and justice in Sudan. https://t.co/oJA9bB3Z20 via @UN_Women https://t.co/W5IQu5r03X

From bamboo bikes 🚴‍♂️ to eco-fashion 👡, young people in Africa are mobilizing their creativity in support of #ClimateAction and the #GlobalGoals. More from @AfricaRenewal: https://t.co/npcuBpIjb5 https://t.co/CVhxVdvApz

50 films from 24 countries have been selected for this year's @MobileFilmFest.
They all highlight the need for urgent #ClimateAction. https://t.co/kSpkjdpUhW #ActNow https://t.co/drT1jJ83ck

The UN:
🇺🇳Feeds 91 million people
🇺🇳Supplies vaccines for 45% of world's children
🇺🇳Protects 71 million people forced to flee
🇺🇳Tackles the climate crisis
🇺🇳Keeps peace with 102,000 peacekeepers
🇺🇳Fights poverty
🇺🇳Promotes human rights

And much more: https://t.co/MGT7G5Mqxj https://t.co/aWqrqctmPp

More than 1.3 million people die in road accidents every year. 

Saving lives by improving road safety is one of the many objectives of the #GlobalGoals. 

-- @antonioguterres on World Day of Remembrance for Road Traffic Victims. https://t.co/r0ih45rDTh https://t.co/YUwuKNicpn

People's data is increasingly being manipulated & monetized. 

In our latest UNcomplicated podcast, a @UNHumanRights expert explains your right to privacy. 🎧
https://t.co/Vwjf1mgMnz

Sunday is World Day of Remembrance for Road Traffic Victims.

Road traffic injuries are a serious public health threat. Join the effort to reduce road casualties & help achieve the #GlobalGoals: https://t.co/PK4FMlEITx https://t.co/jsf4gySBgS

Democratic Republic of Congo: Urgent humanitarian aid & protection needed for thousands displaced by conflict. 

Greater international support required to provide basic necessities & improve dire living conditions. https://t.co/4sucY8Yq7P via @Refugees https://t.co/U03rMA2ZnR

➡️ Wear a seat belt.
➡️ Control your speed. 
➡️ Don't drink and drive.

Almost 3700 people die as a result of road traffic crashes every day.

Stay safe on Sunday's World Day of Remembrance for Road Traffic Victims & every day. https://t.co/PK4FMln7uX https://t.co/xeojnpu3oP

Young filmmakers' stories on migration & diversity received #PLURALplus19 awards at UNHQ in NYC this week. 

Hear from the award winners and learn more about their stories. ⬇️ https://t.co/QoabHEsSsq

📷: “Do unto others as you would have them do unto you” - the "Golden Rule" mosaic based on a painting by US artist Norman Rockwell on display at UNHQ in NYC. 

Saturday is #ToleranceDay: https://t.co/r2uXH8IDnh https://t.co/IQDbb9qAmR

1/3 of our food is lost or wasted every year. 

Here's how you can help reduce food waste:
🛒Shop smart
📅Understand dates on food
🍏Buy 'ugly' fruit & vegetables 

More tips from @FAO: https://t.co/C83tWDTzHD #GlobalGoals https://t.co/aAtLEmNth5

"Intolerance is learned and so can be prevented and unlearned." -- @antonioguterres. 

Saturday is #ToleranceDay: https://t.co/LACZUVQwWl https://t.co/pCMpMe5dWD

After visiting Food for Education initiative providing school meals in Kenya, @aminajmohammed calls for political will, innovation & social enterprise to achieve #ZeroHunger. https://t.co/pDsHovWWb9 #GlobalGoals https://t.co/bSxWuv5EaJ
Let's nurture tolerance & respect for diversity - values which bring people together & make us all stronger - on Saturday's #ToleranceDay & every day. https://t.co/HU1ZOVMoge https://t.co/0W8JzeRKC3

Many of us don’t know that hidden in our personal care products is microplastic - which then gets washed away into our oceans. 🌊

Switch to sustainable, ocean-friendly alternatives for #CleanSeas: https://t.co/kFjK0Bsad8 via @UNEP https://t.co/KINmWe4Bl9

Inclusion and respect towards all people are essential for a more peaceful world. 

More on Saturday's #ToleranceDay: https://t.co/HU1ZOW3ZEO #GlobalGoals https://t.co/jYuS3oDwz4
Adult obesity in Latin America & the Caribbean has tripled since 1975, while 1 in 4 people are going hungry. Urgent action is needed to address malnutrition across the region. https://t.co/vnmWiT4xdl

From refugee to US Army General- meet Lapthe Flora, who joined the United States military to give back to his adoptive country.

Around the 🌏, @Refugees supports people like General Flora, when they are forced to flee their homes. https://t.co/s8xkvEHMSS
https://t.co/NDrtpYZZ3w

Sanitation workers provide an essential public service, but often at the cost of their safety, health & dignity.

New report provides solutions for improving their dire working conditions. - via @ilo https://t.co/DwP64eFxtH

Every year, 12,000 online volunteers help achieve the #GlobalGoals. Join them and team up with @UNVolunteers to contribute to peace & development around the world: https://t.co/oixdK3blas https://t.co/3xyIro5V2V

First-ever humanitarian guidelines on disability inclusion outline essential steps for effectively identifying & responding to rights & needs of people with disabilities during crises. https://t.co/8dNkgzaHvs https://t.co/YhsDtfHpwo

#NairobiSummit wraps up with participants pledging to end maternal deaths, close family planning gaps & eliminate gender-based violence, among other commitments. https://t.co/SaDjF8DnuS #ICPD25 https://t.co/3UphS8nVEk

“This is a significant development, sending a positive signal to the victims of atrocity crimes in Myanmar & elsewhere.”

-- @IntlCrimCourt Prosecutor Fatou Bensouda welcomes judges' decision to open investigation into situation in Bangladesh/Myanmar.
https://t.co/zRLxqs6dGA

Films are a powerful medium for telling stories and creating change.

The @MobileFilmFest features 50 films that highlight the need to #ActNow and take #ClimateAction for a better future for all! https://t.co/kSpkjd8jqo

 https://t.co/9SDhY5Mhf4

420+ million people live with diabetes and it’s the 7th leading cause of death worldwide. 

On Thursday's #WorldDiabetesDay, @WHO recommends key actions to prevent the disease: https://t.co/IG7z4xYdqB https://t.co/RI9ndPgtDR

"More women in peacekeeping means more effective peacekeeping." 

-- @Lacroix_UN explains why recruiting & retaining women is critical for @UNPeacekeeping success. https://t.co/klUqcmg04z

https://t.co/bdaIFD2sOj

"On #WorldDiabetesDay, I voice my support for all individuals around the world living with diabetes, and reaffirm the commitment of the United Nations to fight for their needs and wellbeing on our path towards health for all." 
-- @antonioguterres. https://t.co/xG3VC798fq https://t.co/6QJTLOT78k

🛩️ Drones
💳 Digital Cash
🌱 Hydroponics
🔍 Artificial intelligence 

- just some of the innovative projects helping @WFP respond to emergencies and support those most in need. https://t.co/5vTI15OIsV https://t.co/KFmggzB3vj

"There can be no justification for any attacks against civilians."

-- UN Special Coordinator @nmladenov expresses concern about serious escalation of tensions in Gaza.
https://t.co/9SB9aRvhAE

Exercise🏃‍♀️🚴⛹️‍♀️
Eat healthy🍎🥦🥕
Avoid tobacco use🚭
